item.title: Otsi.mk2
item.description: This article is dedicated to house all of Otsi.mk2’s Project-Logs. Enjoy!

item.title: Pelican Case workstation mk2
item.description: This is a second version of my workstation build inside a Pelican Case.

item.title: Model of my school's robots
item.description: A semi-accurate model of my school’s robotic educational setup.

item.title: Otsi - PCBs rev2
item.description: Project log for Otsi.mk2 focusing on the second revision of PCB’s.

item.title: Arduino Photo-Frame
item.description: An Arduino Photo-Frame based on Raspberry Pi Pico W and ILI9341 3.2inch SPI display.

item.title: Otsi - PCB rev1
item.description: This is the first project-log of Otsi.mk2 showcasing our first PCB.

item.title: VeyToy - desktop timer
item.description: This is one of my one day projects. Created to help me keep focus without my phone or computer

item.title: Chloe - HackYeah2024
item.description: This is a project made in 24h during HackYeah2024 aka. a Hackathon.

item.title: Pelican Case workstation
item.description: This is a 15kg pelican case that houses lab bench power supply, ethernet switch, second screen, charger for my laptop and much more.

item.title: RC car mode
item.description: Warning! This project is not well documented. A-N-Ulab/RC_car-LoRa_driven Controller and reciver for controling rc based on rp2040, heltec_v3 and LoRa C++ 0 0 Story # This project is another simple-ish build but more time than I would like to admit.

item.title: Obsium mk2
item.description: Obsium mk2 is an upgraded version of my beloved Obsium.

item.title: Otsi cyberpet - mk1
item.description: Otsi is a winning design of a cyberpet made for Cyberdeck Cafe’s contest. Main objective of this contest was to build your personal companion that would need to be taken care of and would serve a real life purpose like helping you with everyday tasks.

item.title: Atrovel calculator
item.description: Atrovel calculator is a project that originated from one of my schools lessons.

item.title: Obsium mk1
item.description: Cyberdecks serve a different purpose for everybody. Some create it purely for fun others try to make a perfect „laptop” like device to fulfil all of their needs. For me it is both.

item.title: One-key keyboard
item.description: This is yet another project made for a contest hosted by Cyberdeck Cafe. The objective was to create a keyboard that, as the name suggests, has only one button.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hii, I’m Simon # Who am I? # I’m a 19yo robotics engineering student and a maker. In school I mainly program PLCs (we have siemens s7-1200s) and industrial robots (in labs there are two kuka’s KR 4 R600, one Kuka KR16 and three ABB collaborative robots).

item.title: Contact
item.description: Due to my overuse of computer and phone, even though it is important for what I do. There are two ways to contact me, either via Discord @glinek_tronic or via email simon@glinek.
